data.name: AddRomFilesCommand_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Add selected files to the list of ROMs. ROMs matching the 'known ROMs database' as well as those that appear to be potentially valid will be included.

data.name: AddRomFoldersCommand_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Search for ROMs in the selected folders, and all folders contained within them. The selected directories will be retained in the list of places to search for new ROMs, as configured in the application settings.

data.name: RemoveRomsCommand_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Remove the selected ROMs from the list. The files will remain unchanged on your computer.

data.name: RefreshRomsCommand_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Search folders that have been previously added via the Add Folders command for new ROMs.

data.name: RomListViewModel_InvalidManualMessage
data.value: The selected file is either too large, or contains characters that cannot be displayed on an Intellivision console, and cannot be used as a program manual.

data.name: FileDialog_SelectJlpDataPromptFormat
data.value: Select a Saved Data File for {0}

data.value: The selected save data file is too large.

data.name: FTDIWarning_Message
data.value:
There are known stability problems with the FTDI USB Serial drivers in versions of Mac OS X prior to 10.9. As a result, your computer may crash when disconnecting your LTO Flash!
Be sure to click the Disconnect button (or use the Disconnect menu item) before unplugging your LTO Flash! for improved stability.

data.name: JlpFeatuers_FlashInfoTipTitle
data.value: Minimum Number of JLP Flash Data Sectors

data.name: JlpFeatures_FlashInfoTipBaseFormat
LuigiConversionError_Format
data.value: Failed to create LUIGI file for ROM '{0}'; return code: {1}.

data.name: EditProgramNameCommand_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Edit the selected ROM. This is available only when a single ROM is selected. You may edit the name, vendor, year, and other information about the ROM.

data.name: ShowRomInfoCommand_ToolTipDescription
data.value: When enabled, additional details about the ROMs in the list will be displayed.

data.name: BackupRomListCommand_Complete_Message
data.value: A backup copy of your ROM list has been stored in the following location:

data.name: BackupRomListCommand_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Make a backup copy of the ROM list. Note that this only makes a backup of the list itself. No ROMs are copied.

data.name: EmptyRomListCommand_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Replaces the current ROM list with an empty one.

data.name: RestoreRomListCommand_ToolTipDescription
data.value: Replaces the current ROM list with one from a backup copy. Note that no ROMs will be copied. If ROMs have been moved or deleted since the backup was made, errors may arise.

data.name: ReportDialog_EmailReminder
data.value: Your email address will only be used if further information is needed to investigate this issue.

data.name: ReportDialog_UnableToSendReport_MessageFormat
data.value:
Failed to send crash report email.
Exception message: '{0}'
Copy the text in the error dialog and send it to:
support@intvfunhouse.com

data.name: EmptyRomListCommand_WarningMessage
data.value:
WARNING!
This operation will remove all ROMs from your list!
This will NOT delete any ROMs from your system, but may cause other problems.
Are you sure you wish to proceed?

data.name: RestoreRomListCommand_MissingFileErrorMessage
data.value: The following required backup file could not be found in the backup directory:

data.name: RestoreRomListCommand_Message
data.value:
WARNING!
Restoring the ROM list from a backup will replace the current list!
Would you like to continue with the restore operation?

data.name: GenerateStockCfgFileFailed_MessageFormat
data.value: Failed to generate default .cfg file for {0}.

data.value: Label images may be placed in this directory

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_LocalRomsDirTip

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_ManualsDirTip
data.value: Manuals text files and images may be placed in this directory

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_OverlaysDirTip

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_ShowBoxesDirTip
data.value: Show the directory that may be used to store box images

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_ShowDetailedErrors_Tip
data.value: When checked, more detailed error reports will be presented if an error occurs

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_ShowErrorLogDirTip
data.value: Show the directory used to store error log files

data.name: JlpFeatures_FlashInfoTipHighFormat
data.value: Maximum recommended JLP Flash usage is {0} sectors ({1} KB). Using a larger value requires the program ROM to be less than {2} KB to be installed on current JLP hardware designs.

data.name: JlpFeatures_FlashInfoTipLtoFlashOnlyFormat
data.value: Maximum practical JLP Flash usage is {0} sectors ({1} KB). Using larger sizes is currently only supported on LTO Flash! hardware.

data.name: ValidateRomsCommand_ToolTip
data.value: Checks the ROMs in the list, highlighting any that are missing or have changed.

An error occurred when checking for updates:

data.value: An error occurred when checking for updates. You can disable checking for updates in General application preferences.

data.value: You are running the most recent version!

data.value:
You are running the most recent version!
You can disable checking for updates in the General application preferences.

data.comment: {0} is the message from the error exception

data.name: CheckForUpdatesCommand_Tip
data.value: Check for an updated version of the application

data.name: CheckForUpdatesCommand_TipDescription
data.value: Query the INTV Funhouse website to determine if a newer version of the application can be downloaded.

data.name: CheckForUpdatesCommand_UpdateAvailableFormat
data.comment: {0} is current version, {1} is website URL, {2} is new version

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_CheckForUpdates
data.value: Check for application updates at startup

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_CheckForUpdates_Tip
data.value: Enable this setting to have the application check for udpates when it launches

data.name: CheckForUpdatesCommand_Failed
data.value: An error occurred when checking for updates.

data.name: RunExternalProgram_ErrorFormat
data.comment: {0} is file path, {1} is the error message.

data.name: DeleteFileError_Message
data.value: A problem occurred when deleting a file or directory. See details below.

data.name: DeleteFileError_ReportText
data.value: The file listed below could not be deleted after several attempts. It may be open in another program. You may wish to delete the file manually later.

data.name: RibbonSplitButton_ExtraToolTipDescription
data.value: Click the arrow for more commands.

data.name: EnumToStringConverterDataTypeErrorMessage
data.value: This converter only supports converting string<->EnumString!

data.name: EnumToStringConverterErrorMessage
data.value: This converter requires the desired Enum type to be described as a string of the form: FullTypeName-AssemblyName

data.name: NamedPipeCannotBeRenamedMessage
data.value: You cannot change the configuration of a NamedPipeConnection that is already in use!

data.name: SelectionChangedBehavior_NoSelectedItemsProperty
data.value: Target object has no SelectedItems property to bind.

data.name: SerialPortInvalidByteCountMessageFormat
data.comment: {0}: a number of bytes

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_InvalidCompressionImplementationTypeErrorMessage_Format
data.value: The implementation type '{0}' is not a valid implementation for compressed archive type '{1}'.
data.comment: {0} and {1} are names of internal data type values, which are not localized

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_UnsupportedFormatErrorMessage_Format
data.value: Unable to create an instance of the compressed archive of format '{0}'. The format is not supported.
data.comment: {0} is a compressed archive format name

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_UnableToProcessError_Format
data.comment: {0} is a file path; {1}, {2} and {3} are lists of file formats converted to a string already

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_InvalidCompressionFormatTypeErrorMessage_Format
data.value: The compressed archive type '{0}' is not a valid compressed archive type.
data.comment: {0} is an archive type, whose name is not localized

data.name: CompressedArchiveFormat_FileExtensionAlreadyInUseError_Format
data.value: The file extension '{0}' is already in use by the format '{1}'.
data.comment: {0} is a file extension, {1} is a compressed archive format

data.name: CompressedArchiveFormat_CompountFileExtensionsNotSupportedError
data.value: Compound file extensions are not supported.

data.name: CompressedArchiveFormat_FileExtensionRequiredError
data.value: At least one file extension must be provided.

data.name: CompressedArchiveFormat_FormatIsNotRegisteredError_Format
data.comment: {0} us a compressed archive format, whose name is not localized

data.name: CompressedArchiveFormat_ImplementationRequired
data.value: At least one implementation must be provided.

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_GZipDeleteEntryNotSupported
data.value: The GZIP compresssed file format does not support deletion of an entry.

data.name: GZipHeaderError_InvalidCompression
data.value: Invalid GZIP header: Compression method is not 'Deflate'.

data.name: GZipHeaderError_InvalidMagic
data.value: Invalid GZIP header: Inititial header is not { 0x1F, 0x8B }.

data.name: GZipHeaderError_ReservedFlagsSet
data.value: Invalid GZIP header: Reserved flags must not be set.

data.name: GZipAccess_InvalidModeForCreateEntryError
data.value: The GZip file must be opened in Create mode to add content.

data.name: GZipAccess_MultipleMembersNotSupportedError
data.value: Only one entry may be added to a new GZip file.

data.name: GZipAccess_EntriesAlreadyPresent
data.value: The file must not contain any GZIP members.

data.name: GZipAccess_NoEntriesFound
data.value: The file is not a valid GZIP file.

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_TarDeleteEntryNotSupported
data.value: The TAR file format does not support deletion of an entry.

data.name: GZipAccess_InvalidMode
data.value: The GZIP file format only supports Read and Create modes.

data.name: TarArchiveAccess_InvalidMode
data.value: The TAR file format only supports Read and Create modes.

data.name: TarArchiveAccess_InvalidModeForCreateEntryError
data.value: The TAR file must be opened in Create mode to add content.

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_NestedArchiveNotFound
data.value: The nested archive '{0}' could not be found.
data.comment: {0} is the name of a nested compressed archive

data.name: SettingsDescription
data.value: Settings associated with the primary ROM list (INTV.Shared) and main application window in VINTage.

data.name: EnableMenuIcons
data.value: If 'True' icons are displayed in menus; not honored on all systems

data.name: RomListFeaturesColWidth
data.value: Width of the column that displays the ROM feature glyphs (pixels)

data.name: RomListNameColWidth
data.value: Width of the column that displays the title of a ROM (pixels)

data.name: RomListPathColWidth
data.value: Width of the column that displays the file name of a ROM (pixels)

data.name: RomListVendorColWidth
data.value: Width of the column that displays the name of the publisher of a ROM (pixels)

data.name: RomListYearColWidth
data.value: Width of the column that displays the copyright year of a ROM (pixels)

data.name: WindowPosition
data.value: Last position of the main application window (x, y) (pixels)

data.name: WindowSize
data.value: Last size of the main application window (width, height) (pixels)

data.name: WindowState
data.value: Last state of the main application window (0, Iconified, Maximized, Fullscreen)

data.name: SettingsDescriptionHeader
data.value: # Common application settings # Settings are provided by various components in individual sections. #

data.name: CopyFile_DestinationAlreadyExists_Format
data.comment: {0} is a file path

data.name: PathContainsInvalidCharacters_Format
data.comment: {0} is a file path

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_ExtractEntry_DestinationDirectoryDoesNotExist_Format
data.comment: {0} is a directory path

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_ExtractEntry_EntryIsADirectory_Format
data.value: Requested extraction of a directory, which is not supported: {0}
data.comment: {0} is a compressed file entry name (e.g. a partial file path)

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_IsContainerFailed_LocationCannotExistInArchive_Format
data.value: The path '{0}' does not refer to a location within the compressed archive at '{1}'.
data.comment: {0} and {1} are file paths

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_IsContainerFailed_NoRootLocation_Format
data.value: Unable to determine if '{0}' is a container because compressed library has no root location, but absolute path was provided.
data.comment: {0} is a file path

data.name: DestinationPathIsInArchive_Format
data.comment: {0} is a path

data.name: PathDoesNotReferToAFile_Format
data.value: Path does not refer to a file: {0}
data.comment: {0} is a file path

data.name: PathMustBeRooted_Format
data.value: The path must have a root: {0}
data.comment: {0} is a file path

data.name: StorageArgumentPathIsInvalid
data.comment: {0} is a function argument name

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_All
data.value: Use all supported compressed archive file types

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_All_Tip
data.value: Enable using all compressed archive formats currently supported

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_Custom
data.value: Select compressed archive file types to use

data.name: CompressedArchiveAccess_Custom_Tip
data.value: Select which compressed archive formats to use

data.name: CompressedArchiveFormat_CompoundFormatsAvailable
data.value: The following files will also be recognized:

data.name: CompressedArchiveFormat_MaxSizeConsidered_Tip
data.value: Compressed archive files larger than this size (in Megabytes) are ignored. Set this value to zero (0) to remove the size limitation. You can set this value to 0 - 1024 MB.

data.name: CompressedArchiveFormat_SearchNestedArchives_Tip
data.value: If this option is enabled, and an archive contains another archive within it, include it when searching for ROMs, et. al. Note that this may result in increased memory usage and create copies of nested archives on your system.

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_ShowTempFilesDirTip
data.value: Show the directory used to store temporary files

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_TempFilesDirTip
data.value: Temporary files will be placed in this directory

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_ClearTemporaryFilesOnStartup
data.value: Clear application temporary files at startup

data.name: GeneralSettingsPage_ClearTemporaryFilesOnStartup_Tip
data.value: Enable this setting to have the application delete any abandoned temporary files from a previous session when it launches
